abstract.para: &opensm; is an &infiniband; compliant &subnetmanager; that performs all required tasks for initializing &infiniband; hardware. This procedure shows how to configure &opensm; on &productnameshort;.

tip.para: The opensm command stores its main configuration in /etc/rdma/opensm.conf. Because the main configuration file gets updated on &opensm; upgrades, we recommend editing /etc/rdma/opensm instead to prevent the need to merge changes manually.

step.para: Install the &opensm; package on any hosts that will be running the &subnetmanager;.
Use the ibstat -p command to find GUID0 and GUID1 of the host channel adapter (HCA) ports, for example:
If you are using a single switch, follow these steps:
Edit the /etc/rdma/opensm file to add the identifier for the corresponding port.
step.screen: &prompt.sudo;opensm -c /etc/rdma/opensm # The port GUID on which the OpenSM is running guid 0x248a070300a80a80

step.para: If you are using s direct connect method or if you have multiple switches, enable the &subnetmanager; on each port of the connected HCA on the host:

Add the following lines to /etc/rc.d/after.local. Substitute the GUID0 and GUID1 with your discovered values. For P0 and P1, use the &subnetmanager; priorities, with 1 being the lowest and 15 the highest.
step.screen: opensm -B -g GUID0 -p P0 -f /var/log/opensm-ib0.log opensm -B -g GUID1 -p P1 -f /var/log/opensm-ib1.log
